name: Musical Theatre and Entertainment
description: Range of styles of theatre individually popular in the United States or in various countries in Europe, mostly from the 19th century to the mid-20th century.

sub_genres.name: Ballad Opera
sub_genres.description: English reaction to the Italian Opera styles with a satirical sense of humor and scores borrowing from Traditional Folk Music and popular music.

sub_genres.name: Cabaret
sub_genres.description: Entertainment featuring Comedy, song, dance, and theatre.

sub_genres.name: Comédie-ballet
sub_genres.description: French form of musical drama from the 17th century that combines operatic singing, classical dance, and theater.

sub_genres.name: Cuplé
sub_genres.description: Originally developed in the 19th century as a blend of old theatre Spanish styles based in short monologues (jácara and tonadilla) and French Couplet.

sub_genres.name: Dutch Cabaret
sub_genres.description: Popular comedy form in the Netherlands which evolved out of traditional Cabaret in the 1890s.

sub_genres.name: Kabarett
sub_genres.description: Theatrical entertainment consisting of mixed elements of music, sketches, monologues, dialogues, lyric poetry and/or ballads.

sub_genres.name: Kanto
sub_genres.description: Songs performed at the Tuluat Theaters of İstanbul in the late 19th century.

sub_genres.name: Minstrelsy
sub_genres.description: Popular song and entertainment tradition from the U.S. engendered in variety shows employing racist caricature and blackface.

sub_genres.name: Murga
sub_genres.description: Popular carnival music traditional in some cities of Spain and Hispanic America.

sub_genres.name: Music Hall
sub_genres.description: British theatrical entertainment popular in the 19th and 20th centuries, featuring light and comedic popular songs.

sub_genres.name: Operetta
sub_genres.description: Light opera interspersed with spoken dialogues, being usually satirical and/or humorous in nature and centered around romantic plots and dancing scenes.

sub_genres.name: Revue
sub_genres.description: French Musical Theatre and Entertainment based on numbers and sketches inspired by the most relevant events of the year.

sub_genres.name: Rock Musical
sub_genres.description: Style of musical theatre inspired by Rock.

sub_genres.name: Show Tunes
sub_genres.description: Originally composed to forward the story or enhance the characters or other plot elements of Broadway productions and other stage music.

sub_genres.name: Siffleur
sub_genres.description: Professional whistlers on the Vaudeville and Music Hall circuits.

sub_genres.name: Singspiel
sub_genres.description: German form of Opera distinguished by the prominent usage of spoken dialogues mixed with lyrical or folklore arias/ballads.

sub_genres.name: Vaudeville
sub_genres.description: Performed in American musical theaters typically as part of a lowbrow, often comedic variety performance.
